description: You are locked in a themed room and need to find your way out, but hurry time is ticking! By using your physical abilities, logical sense and teamwork, you find clues and solve puzzles that will lead to your big escape! Whether you are escaping a prison, ancient pyramid or even a serial killerâ€™s basement, you are sure to have a good time!

reviews.title: Fun activity for kid's birthdays
text: Such a fun activity for my kid's birthday party, we played the final destination room, the puzzles are well desinged, the rooms was nicely decorated like a realy plane, we escape just within 1 hour, highly recomended for a fun activity for kids.

reviews.title: fun activity for kids birthday
text: fun activity for kids birthday,  our favorite ones are Ninja nd Final Destinaton. conveniently located right downtown on Yonge Street

reviews.title: Much better options for your money
text: Average rooms at best and over priced.  Customer service stops once they get your money.  When we completed our rooms, no one at the exit to greet or congratulate us....we walked BACK to the front desk and were asked, "Did you complete the room "? They had no idea. When we asked for a clue, there was no hints, just told is the answer.....not how this works.  we have done over 60 rooms and these rank in the bottom 10% unfortunately.  We did 2 rooms, and ONLY did the 2nd one because if we didn't they were going to charge our credit card regardless. We have made a practice of doing all rooms that a company has to offer and we absolutely not be doing that in this case.
Very poor all around. Rooms were run down and dilapidated,  sensors weren't working properly in one of the rooms. Very disappointing.

reviews.title: Manager will protect you from wild animals, and the room was awesome.
text: A bird flew up the stairs and terrorized us, but the manager was able to gently catch the bird and safely release it back in the open.
I did the Ninja room and it was a lot of fun.
The puzzles were challenging but not impossible to solve. The room was designed well, and we felt immersed in the room.
A lot of great team work was needed to escape.
Will be coming back again.

reviews.title: Excellent Escape Rooms and Staff
text: We have done 2 of their rooms and will be doing the rest on our next visit to Toronto!!  Both experiences have been fantastic as the rooms are very well designed and smartly thought out.   We love escape rooms and roundabout gas become one of our favourites.

reviews.title: Amazing staff and great rooms!
text: I have been to Roundabout twice since it's close to Ryerson and the staff has been helpful both the times. I tried their Ninja and Airplane room, which are two completely different rooms and had a fun time with my bff's.

reviews.title: BEST ESCAPE ROOM!!!
text: I went there with some of my friends and we end up playing two rooms, because the staff was so friendly and they also show us sneak peek of their other rooms which was so nice of them. We also got group photo and their props were so interesting. If you looking for a place to enjoy some fun games, I'll recommend this place.

reviews.title: great escape room in the heart of Downtown Toronto
text: The location is great, right downtown at Yonge & Dundas, many touristic sites around the corner. We had an amazing time in the Butcher's Basement room. The room set up was fantastic and the puzzles were the perfect level of difficulty for us. There  are 5 rooms at different difficulty level. the staffs are very friendly and knowledgeable. The place is well organized and nicely decorated. we highly recommend it!

reviews.title: Waste of money
text: Myself and a group of 7 paid for an escape experience at this location called Prisoners. I need to start off by saying that we paid 8 multiplied by $33 each. We escaped within 22 minutes; however, after exiting we realized we missed several locks because one of the locks in the middle was broken and allowed us to skip half the room. This ruined our escape experience, as evidently the room was not reset property. Further, the escape room itself had no storyline, set up, and the room was smaller and poorly built. What was worse was there was no evident manager on site or available. When we spoke to the front desk, she offered us 10% off our next game, then after further discussion she offered 20% and finally dropped back down to 10% (she did not have proper protocol training on this). There was zero accountability for what had been done, no refund was offered and all of the staff were extremely unprofessional. Definitely my worst escape game experience, a shame it had to be with 7 other friends. Please do yourself a favour (save your wallet) and do not go to this escape room.

reviews.title: Final Destination 2.0
text: On our second escape of the day we headed to Roundabout Canada to take on the Final Destination 2.0 room. The two staff members were very welcoming and friendly on our arrival.

The room itself was a cleverly constructed environment, with multiple aspects that gave you a good sense of progress through the game. Nothing felt particularly out of place, with a clear mimetic structure that flowed. The puzzles themselves were smart and although we did require a couple clues, these were mostly down to our own ignorance! The linearity of the room was not overbearing, and enabled all three of us to enjoy the full experience.
A great time was had resolving the troubles of flight RA280 and we succeeded with little over 10 minutes to spare.
We shall be returning in the future to check out some of the other rooms Roundabout Canada has to offer!

reviews.title: Great escape room for small groups
text: My wife and I had a great experience.  Well done room with great props.  Very nice that you do not have others added to your group.

reviews.title: Superb time!
text: For my first escape room experience,  this was really fun. The staff was kind and walked us through on what to expect without spoiling the game. I tried Tony's butcher. The theme and decorations were cool. The clues were challenging but once you get thinking on how to solve them, it just gets better. I plan on my next escape room with Roundabout soon!

reviews.title: The Ninja room is a whole lot of fun.
text: Not your traditional escape room.  This room fully embraced it's theme and had some really fun physical puzzles.  The staff were super-friendly and spent a lot of time with us talking about escape rooms after we finished the room.  I would recommend this room.

reviews.title: Great experience
text: Was given extra time since no one booked right after us, super friendly staff, very helpful, it was my friend's first time doing escape rooms, and we both really enjoyed it. 10/10 would try the other rooms as well.

reviews.title: Revisited
text: Revisit again and again, always fun to play all the different rooms. Was fun to go with different friends playing the same room as well.

reviews.title: great fun
text: Roundabout Canada is the best escape room i have been to. i played the room Prisoner with 4 other people. It was very well designed. puzzles are extremely elaborated. highly recommended.

reviews.title: The Prisoner Room
text: Excellent !!! Tried out The Prisoner which required good teamwork from our group of six.  Definitely will come back for the rest of the rooms.  Good Job RoundaboutCanada !!!

reviews.title: Keep coming back
text: 3rd time coming back to this place. Lots of different rooms to choose from and all the rooms that I've tried are challenging. Can't wait to come back for the 4th time.

reviews.title: Lots of fun!
text: We went as a group of 7 and did the escape room the prisoner. We had a great time! Challenging but a great group activity. The staff were very friendly and helpful if you you get stuck. The actual room was very well done aesthetically and had a good variety of different tasks/locks/activities to solve.

reviews.title: Amazing Staff & Customer Service, Tricky Room
text: I cannot say enough wonderful things about the staff here. I accidentally booked our party for the wrong day. They called me and SO kindly asked if we were still planning to come and I was mortified that I had booked it incorrectly. The girl was amazing, said it wasn't a problem at all and that they had the same time slot free on the correct day. She simply moved our appointment and all was well. I thought for sure they would be upset or charge me for my error but they were wonderful.

We did the Ninja room and we had a ton of fun except for one part. One of the puzzles is REALLY difficult. We knew what we had to do but it just wasn't working and we were getting really frustrated. It ate up a lot of our time and we really weren't having fun anymore - but the employee actually offered us a tip without us even asking and let us know that we could bypass that part if we wanted to - which we DID and then we solved the whole room and celebrated. So I do wish that we knew we could bypass it earlier, but in the end we were all super satisfied.

reviews.title: Fun escape room
text: We had some time to kill and decided to do one of the escape rooms. We chose to do the Ninja Room. There was four of us and we managed to escape! Yay!

reviews.title: Prisoner room was okay.
text: Great team building experience. Had such a great time communicating and coordinating with my fellow allies to achieve victory.

reviews.title: Great team building experience
text: Booked an 'intermediate' room for my team as a team building outing. So much fun! We had a great time solving the puzzles and WORKING TOGETHER! Overall, a great experience.

reviews.title: Loved it.
text: Such a good time! I worked at an escape room for a few years and roundabout exceeded my expectations in every way. Very good tech, solid puzzles, love the timer. Definitely doesn't cheap out on any of the rooms like I was used to working with. Clean, staff seem respectful of one another, no smell, nothing broken, ðŸ’¯

reviews.title: Prisoner room was okay. Staff doesn't care
text: Escape room was decent. Staff pretty much puts you in the room and doesn't really pay attention to you for an hour. Most escape rooms have engaged staff that follows along with what is going on. Very difficult to even know if certain clues are unlocked or not. I realize they can't actually lock you in cages. But we had no idea if we had unlocked them or not. Also note that this room is 100% in the dark. I figured there would eventually be a clue that would turn on the lights. There isn't. Be prepared to be in the dark the entire time.

reviews.title: FInal Destination - NOT Worth It (Serious Cleaning and Repair Required)
text: We visited the Final Destination room.   Note that we have already completed over 20 rooms in various locations.   We were rather disappointed for a number of reasons starting with the fact that it was not clear that the initial screen had stopped loading.  The room was filthy, far too dark to read anything such as the lock dials (with only 1 flashlight), required serious repair (such as the seat which was not secure) and really poorly done.  I will not recommend this room to anyone and will not return.

reviews.title: Revisited
text: Revisit again and again, always fun to play all the different rooms. Was fun to go with different friends playing the same room as well. Watching them solve the puzzle which you know the answer already.

reviews.title: Perfect for beginners!
text: We had a group of 2 and did the Butchers Basement escape room it was perfect for 2 people. Its rated beginner with a 45% success rate. We solved and escaped. Can't wait to do another one.

reviews.title: Great room, okay customer service
text: My husband and I did the Butcher's Basement room (we succeeded!). This was the 7th escape room we've done, and while not my favourite, it was really well done. This is one of their beginner rooms with a high escape rate, so it's pretty easy if you have a little escape room experience. It was fun nonetheless! Most of the puzzles were number locks, but the method of finding each code varied and was creative, so it didn't feel like we were doing the same puzzle over and over again. The story about the room on the website is different from the story you get once you enter the room, but it doesn't really matter in the end. This room is for 2-8 people, but I think anything beyond 4 will be very cramped - especially in the first room.

The hint system is summoning a GM with a walkie talkie, and they enter the room to help you out. Some places will stop the time for this kind of hint system, but this place does not. When we exited the room after finishing, we saw someone at the front desk asking for a clue because no one was answering the walkie talkie.

The lobby leaves a lot to be desired, but considering the location I'm not surprised it's as small as it is. There was a family who had just finished a room when we walked in, and that made it a little crowded and confusing. There was no orientation like I've seen at other rooms. Just an explanation of how the locks work, how to use the walkie talkie, and off you go.

The ladies working there were really nice, but a little lacking in enthusiasm compared to other rooms. We finished with lots of time to spare (although 2 of those minutes were spent waiting for a GM to come to us), but our victory was a little anti-climatic when the GM looked at us and said, "Oh you found _____? Okay you're done."
Despite the small negatives, I look forward to coming back and checking out the other rooms.

reviews.title: It Was My First Escape Room Experience; Won't Be My Last
text: I don't have a point of comparison but registering and getting instructions was a straightforward experience.

We chose an expert level room (25% success rate) and it lived up to the label! We did escape -- just not in the allotted 45 minutes. (The room wasn't booked after us and they didn't kick us out so it took us 60 minutes to escape.) And that was just one of the bigger lessons reinforced by the experience: don't stop pursuing your goal until you are absolutely out of options!!
If you're looking for a place with additional activities or a comfy lounge, this isn't the place. But if you want a straightforward escape experience with good puzzles, give it a try!

reviews.title: A bit ambiguous
text: We visited this escape room and did the butchers basement.  The idea behind the room was unique and the set up of the rooms was cool.  We hit a few road bumps along the way.  The first lock was left unlocked so the 20 minutes we spent solving the puzzle was for nothing.  As we have been to a lot of rooms, this felt like a rookie mistake on their part.  There was one clue which was set up poorly and even when explained afterward, it did not show the correct answer.  Also the theme of the room should be explained before the timer starts so you know what you are looking for in keeping with the story.  The noise level of the lobby and the players in the other rooms ruined the atmosphere as well.  Overall we had fun but there are better rooms out there.

reviews.title: Great fun
text: We booked this for a fun activity while on holiday in Toronto and we all had a great time. We did the Back to the Mummy room we all had lots of fun trying to figure out all the different puzzles.

There are lockers that you can use to store your items in before you go into the room. Staff were friendly and very helpful if you needed them. Would recommend doing one of the rooms they have if you are anywhere near by.

reviews.title: Roundabout Canada
text: It was so much fun, we loved The butcher's basement, we'll be back to try Tye other rooms with my family and friends.

reviews.title: Best escape room downtown!
text: Came in for my birthday with a group of friends,we did the Prisoner room, it was so much fun,we loved it so much,we'll be come back again to try the butcher's basement next week.

reviews.title: NINJA ROOM&FD2.0: so far so good
text: Ninja:
Immersion was great, high quality set.
NO NUMBER LOCKS, very inventive creative minds behind this one... which made it very fun. Highly recommend.
Final Destination 2.0:
Fun, logical, well made.
Of the two we liked Ninja more but we started with Final Destination 2.0 so it was good enough to come back.
We will be doing the Butcher next. Fun place!

reviews.title: Challenging and immersive
text: Can I just say, compared to the escape rooms I was used to this room was HARD!!! We did not go into this thinking we would struggle to get out in time as we have done plenty of other escape rooms, but we barely made it out! Do not underestimate this one. We did the Butcher's basement, and not only where there puzzles but there were physical elements to the problem solving that were quite unique. Very enjoyable experience and we will be back! An added plus that they allow 2 people to book a room!!!

reviews.title: Great
text: First time in an escape room, had a lot of fun!
The staff are nice.
Will come again with a larger group of people.

reviews.title: Disappointment with Butcher's Basement
text: We were very disappointed that the room was not sound proofed. I've done many escape rooms and this has to have been the worst experience because of this. We were in the "Butcher's Basement" and could hear the noise in the lobby the entire time. We heard the staff talking and chatting which completely destroyed any 'horror' feel or 'realness'. Moreover, most escape rooms will blind fold you to bring you into the room so it feels like you are literally in the essence of the story and 'trapped' in the room. The person who brought us into the room just simply opened the door from the lobby, walked us in and gave us some rules about the room while we were in it.  Moreover, the experience could have been a lot better if they brought us into a quiet room, gave us the story to make it feel real, spoke about some rules, then led/blind folded us into the room and let us figure it out. I feel like they should have just given us a synopsis of what we can and cannot touch/move around in the room (or put stickers on it) without actually entering with us from the beginning.

The other problem we had was the help system. There was a phone in the room (typical), but what made it terrible was when the staff entered the room to come help us out. Once again, we were taken out of the experience. The hints were also very direct, it would have been nice if they weren't obvious and another riddle to help figure out.

The last issue we had with the room was after we got out. It was a pretty lacklustre/non existent after-play experience. We got out of the room and the staff said nothing to us other than "Have a good night!". Not even asking how our experience was, congratulating us, asking how we found the room, talk to us about other rooms, etc. It was very uncomfortable and pretty much felt like a get-your-stuff-and-leave-right-away feel. Most escape rooms have a picture booth or something like that, but this place had nothing.
Some pros to the room were that they were were well designed/very scary. It's very clear they put a lot of thought into the design to make it realistic. They were often shrieking moments.
The puzzles were pretty basic so it's a great room for beginners.
Some real tips to make the experience better:
- Sound proof the room!!!!
- Staff should not enter the room with the players.
-  Staff should also give a back story to the room to the players beforehand and explain anything needed outside the room without going in.
- Make the hints a little less obvious and more riddle filled.
- Provide an after-play experience to make the players feel good when/if they get out or even if they don't.

reviews.title: Best escape rooms in Toronto
text: I've done a bunch (maybe 15) escape rooms and by far Roundabout exceeded my expectations. Loved it so much that we came back and finished all 5 of them. The staff were friendly, and helpful each time had a great experiance.  Solid puzzles, great use of technology, props were on point and the rooms looked amazing.
If you have done escape rooms before and enjoy them give this one a try you will be amazed. I first read about Final Destination on Narcity and was excited to check it out. Wow great room!!
The rooms we did at Roundabout are: Butcher's Basement, The Ninja, Final Destination 2.0, The Prisoner, and Back to The Mummy.
Hoping this is helpful! If so, let me know by clicking "helpful". If you have any questions ask away, I'll be happy to answer them.  Happy escaping!

reviews.title: Dissappointing
text: Expensive and practically no customer service. When we expressed our disappointment we were treated by â€˜robotsâ€™, not human beings. Will never come again and will warn everybody I know.
Shame!
